name: add_comment_to_file
description:
Creates a body on a file.

This function creates a new body on the specified Google Drive file with
input validation and error handling.

target_file_for_comment_id.description: The ID of the file to comment on.

content.description: The plain text content of the comment.

emailAddress.description: Valid email address of the author.

value.description: The quoted content text (required if quotedFileContent provided).

mimeType.description: MIME type of the quoted content (required if quotedFileContent provided).

resolved.description: Whether the comment is resolved (defaults to False).

comment_data.description:
Dictionary containing comment properties. If None,
an empty dictionary is used. Supported keys:

name: add_new_drive_item
description: Creates a new file or folder with permissions if quota allows.

mimeType.description:
MIME type of the file. Can be:
    - 'application/vnd.google-apps.document'
    - 'application/vnd.google-apps.spreadsheet'
    - 'application/vnd.google-apps.presentation'
    - 'application/vnd.google-apps.drawing'
    - 'application/vnd.google-apps.folder'
    - 'application/vnd.google-apps.script'

size.description: File size in bytes (string that must be convertible to integer).

permissions.description: List of permission objects with keys:

item_properties.description: Dictionary of file properties with keys:

md5Checksum.description: MD5 checksum of the file content.

sha1Checksum.description: SHA1 checksum of the file content.

sha256Checksum.description: SHA256 checksum of the file content.

mimeType.description: MIME type of the file content.

filePath.description: Path to file for content upload.

upload_content_details.description: Dictionary containing media content properties with keys:

require_single_parent.description: Whether to enforce single parent. Defaults to False.

disregard_default_visibility_settings.description: Whether to ignore default visibility. Defaults to False.

retain_revision_permanently.description: Whether to keep revision forever. Defaults to False.

set_ocr_language_code.description: The language to use for OCR. Defaults to empty string.

allow_operations_on_all_drives.description: Whether to support all drives. Defaults to False.

allow_operations_on_team_drives.description: Whether to support team drives. Defaults to False.

make_content_searchable.description: Whether to use content as indexable text. Defaults to False.

additional_view_permissions_list.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include. Defaults to empty string.

comma_separated_labels_list.description: Comma-separated list of labels to include. Defaults to empty string.

name: add_new_file_version
description:
Create a new revision for a file.

This function creates a new revision for a file with the given content. It
generates a unique revision ID based on the existing revisions in the file's
data structure, creates a revision content structure matching the expected
JSON format, and validates the revision using the RevisionModel. The function
then adds the revision to the file's revisions list.

revising_user_id.description: The ID of the user creating the revision.

target_document_id.description: The ID of the file to which the revision is being added.

revision_byte_content.description: The content to be added to the revision.

name: add_reply_to_comment
description: Creates a reply to a comment.

photoLink.description: A link to the author's profile photo.

reply_content_and_author.description: Dictionary containing the reply details with keys:

name: conceal_shared_drive_from_view
description: Hides a shared drive from the default view.

drive_id_to_hide.description: The ID of the shared drive to hide. Must be a non-empty string.

name: convert_and_download_google_file
description: Exports a Google Doc to the requested MIME type and returns binary content.

google_document_id.description: The ID of the file to export. Must be a non-empty string.

export_format_mime_type.description: The MIME type to export to. Must be a non-empty string.

name: convert_and_retrieve_file_data
description:
Export file content to a different format.

This function exports the content of a file to a different format. It checks
if the export is cached and returns the cached content if available. If not,
it decodes the current content, validates the export format, and exports the
content to the target MIME type. Finally, it caches the exported content and
returns the exported content.

exporting_user_id.description: The ID of the user exporting the file content.

source_file_id_for_export.description: The ID of the file to export content from.

destination_format_mime.description: The target MIME type for export.

name: create_new_file_identifiers
description: Generates a set of file IDs.

id_usage_space.description: The space in which the IDs can be used.

name: download_file_data
description:
Get file content, optionally for a specific revision.

This function retrieves the content of a file, optionally for a specific revision.
If a revision ID is provided, it searches the file's revisions list for the matching
revision and returns its content. If no revision ID is provided, it returns the current
content of the file.

account_holder_id.description: The ID of the user retrieving the file content.

document_identifier.description: The ID of the file to retrieve content from.

specific_version_id.description: Optional revision ID to get specific revision.

name: duplicate_drive_item
description: Creates a copy of a file if quota allows.

source_file_identifier.description: The ID of the file to copy. Must be a non-empty string.

name.description: Name of the copied file. If not provided, defaults to "Copy of {original_file_name}".

parents.description: List of parent folder IDs. If not provided, inherits from original file.

role.description:
The role granted by this permission. Allowed values:
        - 'viewer': Can view the file
        - 'commenter': Can view and comment on the file
        - 'editor': Can view, comment, and edit the file
        - 'owner': Has full control over the file

type.description:
The type of the grantee. Allowed values:
        - 'user': Permission granted to a specific user
        - 'group': Permission granted to a group
        - 'domain': Permission granted to a domain
        - 'anyone': Permission granted to anyone with the link

emailAddress.description: The email address of the user or group.

domain.description: The domain name of the entity this permission refers to.

allowFileDiscovery.description: Whether the permission allows the file to be discovered through search.

expirationTime.description: The time at which this permission will expire, in RFC 3339 format.

permissions.description: List of permission objects. Each permission object may include the following fields:

copy_metadata.description: Dictionary of file properties with keys:

override_domain_visibility.description: Whether to ignore default visibility set by domain administrators. Defaults to False.

preserve_revision_indefinitely.description: Whether to keep revision forever. Defaults to False.

optical_char_recognition_language.description: The language to use for OCR. Defaults to empty string.

enable_all_drives_support.description: Whether to support all drives. Defaults to False.

enable_team_drives_support.description: Whether to support team drives. Defaults to False.

specify_view_permissions_to_include.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include. Defaults to empty string.

specify_labels_to_include.description: Comma-separated list of labels to include. Defaults to empty string.

name: edit_comment_reply
description: Updates a reply.

reply_id_to_update.description: The ID of the reply to update.

content.description: The updated content of the reply.

photoLink.description: A link to the author's profile photo.

author.description: Updated information about the author with keys:

updated_reply_data.description: Dictionary containing the updated reply details with keys:

name: edit_file_comment
description: Updates a comment with patch semantics.

file_id_of_comment.description: The ID of the file the comment belongs to.

comment_id_to_update.description: The ID of the comment to update.

displayName.description: The display name of the author.

emailAddress.description: The email address of the author.

author.description: Dictionary of author information with keys:

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the quoted content.

quotedFileContent.description: Dictionary of quoted content with keys:

anchor.description: The anchor point of the comment.

resolved.description: Whether the comment has been resolved.

updated_comment_content.description: Dictionary of comment properties to update with keys:

name: enumerate_comment_replies
description: Lists a comment's replies.

file_id_for_reply_listing.description: The ID of the file. Must not be empty.

comment_id_for_reply_listing.description: The ID of the comment. Must not be empty.

include_deleted_replies_in_list.description: Whether to include deleted replies. Defaults to False.

replies_per_page.description: Maximum number of replies to return per page. Must be positive. Defaults to 20.

reply_list_page_cursor.description: Token for the next page of results. Defaults to an empty string.

name: enumerate_file_comments
description: Lists comments for a file.

file_identifier_for_listing_comments.description: The ID of the file to list comments for. Cannot be empty.

include_deleted_comments_in_list.description:
Whether to include deleted comments.
If False, deleted comments are excluded from the response. Defaults to False.

comments_per_page.description:
Maximum number of comments to return per page.
Must be between 1 and 100, inclusive. Defaults to 20.

comment_list_page_cursor.description:
Page token for continuing a previous list request.
Provides the starting point for pagination. Expected to be an integer string if provided.
Defaults to an empty string.

filter_comments_modified_since.description:
The start time to filter comments by.
Only comments modified on or after this timestamp are returned.
Format: RFC 3339 timestamp (e.g., '2023-01-01T00:00:00Z').
Defaults to an empty string (no time filter).

name: enumerate_file_permissions
description: Lists a file's or shared drive's permissions.

subject_file_id.description: The ID of the file or shared drive.

include_all_drives_permissions.description: Whether to support all drives. If True, includes permissions from all drives. Defaults to False.

include_team_drives_permissions.description: Whether to support team drives. If True, includes team drive specific permissions. Defaults to False.

fetch_with_domain_admin_access.description: Whether to use domain admin access. If True, includes domain-wide permissions. Defaults to False.

name: enumerate_file_versions
description:
List all revisions for a file.

This function retrieves all revisions for a file. It returns the file's revisions
list, which is a list of dictionaries containing the revision information.

querying_user_id.description: The ID of the user retrieving the revisions.

document_id_for_revisions.description: The ID of the file to retrieve revisions from.

name: enumerate_user_shared_drives
description:
Lists the user's shared drives.

This function returns a list of shared drives that the user is a member of.
It supports filtering by drive properties through the `q` parameter
and allows for pagination using `pageSize` and `pageToken`.

drives_per_page_limit.description:
Maximum number of shared drives to return per page.
Must be an integer between 1 and 100.

drive_search_query.description:
Query string for searching shared drives. 
The query supports the following fields and operators:
    - Fields: 'name', 'id', 'createdTime', 'hidden', 'themeId'
    - Operators: =, !=, <, <=, >, >=, contains, in
You can combine conditions with 'and' and 'or'.
String values must be quoted. Example queries:
    "name = 'My Drive'"
    "name contains 'Project' and hidden = false"
    "createdTime >= '2023-01-01T00:00:00Z'"
    "name = 'Team Drive' or themeId = 'blue-theme'"

drive_list_page_token.description:
(Optional) A base64-encoded token for pagination. The token encodes a JSON object with:
- 'last_row_time' (str): The unix timestamp (as a string) when the last page was generated.
- 'offset' (int): The offset (index) to start the next page from.

name: erase_drive_item_forever
description: Permanently deletes a file owned by the user without moving it to trash.

target_item_identifier.description: The ID of the file to delete.

apply_single_parent_rule.description: Whether to enforce single parent. Defaults to False.

confirm_all_drives_access.description: Whether to support all drives. Defaults to False.

confirm_team_drives_access.description: Whether to support team drives. Defaults to False.

name: fetch_comment_reply_by_id
description:
Gets a reply by ID from a comment on a file.

This function retrieves a specific reply to a comment on a Google Drive file.
Deleted replies are excluded by default unless explicitly requested.

reply_identifier_to_fetch.description: The ID of the reply to retrieve.

show_deleted_reply.description:
Whether to include deleted replies in the response.
Defaults to False. When False, deleted replies return None.

name: fetch_drive_modifications
description:
Lists the changes for a user or shared drive.

This method retrieves a list of changes that have occurred since the specified 
page token. Changes include file additions, modifications, deletions, and 
permission changes.

change_log_page_token.description:
The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page.
This token is obtained from a previous changes.list request or from 
changes.getStartPageToken(). Cannot be empty.

target_drive_id_for_changes.description:
The ID of the shared drive for which changes are returned.
Only changes to files within this shared drive will be returned.
Defaults to empty string (user's My Drive).

show_corpus_removals.description:
Whether changes should include the file resource 
if the file is still accessible by the user at the time of the request.
Defaults to False.

scan_all_drives_for_changes.description:
Whether both My Drive and shared drive items 
should be included in results. Defaults to False.

report_removed_items.description:
Whether to include changes indicating that items have 
been removed from the list of changes. Defaults to True.

report_team_drive_item_changes.description:
**DEPRECATED** - Use includeItemsFromAllDrives 
instead. Whether to include changes for team drive items. Defaults to False.

changes_per_page_limit.description:
Maximum number of changes to return per page. Must be between 
1 and 1000 inclusive. Defaults to 100.

limit_to_my_drive_changes.description:
Whether to restrict the results to changes inside 
the My Drive hierarchy. This cannot be used together with teamDriveId or driveId.
Defaults to False.

data_spaces_to_query.description:
A comma-separated list of spaces to query within the user corpus.
Supported values are 'drive', 'appDataFolder', and 'photos'. Defaults to 'drive'.

enable_all_drives_change_scan.description:
Whether the requesting application supports both 
My Drives and shared drives. Defaults to False.

enable_team_drives_change_scan.description:
**DEPRECATED** - Use supportsAllDrives instead.
Whether the requesting application supports Team Drives. Defaults to False.

target_team_drive_id_for_changes.description:
**DEPRECATED** - Use driveId instead. The ID of the Team Drive 
for which changes will be returned. Defaults to empty string.

fetch_permissions_for_view_in_changes.description:
Specifies which additional view's permissions 
to include in the response. Only 'published' is supported. Defaults to empty string.

fetch_labels_in_changes.description:
A comma-separated list of IDs of labels to include in 
the labelInfo part of the response. Defaults to empty string.

name: fetch_file_comment_by_id
description: Gets a comment by ID.

file_identifier_for_comment.description: The ID of the file the comment belongs to.

comment_identifier_to_fetch.description: The ID of the comment to get.

name: fetch_item_details
description: Gets a file's metadata.

item_id_to_fetch.description: The ID of the file to retrieve.

name: fetch_permission_details
description:
Gets a permission by ID.

Retrieves a specific permission by its ID for the specified file. The function
supports various access patterns including shared drives and domain admin access.

file_identifier_for_permission_lookup.description: The ID of the file or shared drive. Must be a non-empty string.

permission_identifier_to_get.description: The ID of the permission to retrieve. Must be a non-empty string.

check_all_drives.description:
Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives 
and shared drives. Defaults to False.

check_team_drives.description:
Whether to support team drives. Deprecated - use 
supportsAllDrives instead. Defaults to False.

use_domain_admin_privileges.description:
Issue the request as a domain administrator. If set to 
true, grants access if the file ID refers to a shared drive and the requester 
is an administrator of the domain to which the shared drive belongs. Defaults to False.

name: get_user_installed_applications
description:
Lists a user's installed apps.

This function retrieves all installed apps for the current user and applies
optional filtering based on file extensions and MIME types. The languageCode
parameter is accepted for API compatibility but does not affect the current
implementation.

filter_by_file_extensions.description:
A comma-separated list of file extensions 
to filter by (e.g., "pdf,txt,docx"). Only apps that support these extensions
will be returned. Defaults to '' (no filtering).

filter_by_mime_types.description:
A comma-separated list of MIME types to 
filter by (e.g., "text/plain,application/pdf"). Only apps that support 
these MIME types will be returned. Defaults to '' (no filtering).

preferred_language_code.description:
The language code to use for localized strings.
Currently unused but accepted for API compatibility. Defaults to ''.

name: grant_file_access
description: Creates a permission for a file or shared drive.

target_file_for_permission_id.description: The ID of the file or shared drive.

role.description:
The role granted by this permission, defaults to 'reader' (alias for 'viewer'). Possible values:
    - 'viewer': Can view the file
    - 'commenter': Can view and comment on the file
    - 'editor': Can view, comment, and edit the file
    - 'owner': Has full control over the file

type.description:
The type of the grantee, defaults to 'user'. Possible values:
    - 'user': Permission granted to a specific user
    - 'group': Permission granted to a group
    - 'domain': Permission granted to a domain
    - 'anyone': Permission granted to anyone with the link

emailAddress.description: The email address of the user or group to grant the permission to. This will be normalized to lowercase.

domain.description: The domain name (e.g. 'example.com') of the entity this permission refers to.

allowFileDiscovery.description: Whether the permission allows the file to be discovered through search, defaults to False.

expirationTime.description: The time at which this permission will expire, in RFC 3339 format. Example: `'2025-06-30T12:00:00Z'` (UTC) or `'2025-06-30T08:00:00-04:00'`.

permission_details.description: Dictionary of permission properties with keys:

name: modify_drive_item
description:
Updates a file's metadata or content with patch semantics. 

This means only the fields explicitly provided in the `body` dictionary
will be updated. All other file properties will remain unchanged.

file_identifier_to_update.description: The ID of the file to update.

mimeType.description: New MIME type of the file.

parents.description: New list of parent folder IDs.

metadata_updates.description: Dictionary of file properties to update with keys:

md5Checksum.description: MD5 checksum of the file content.

sha1Checksum.description: SHA1 checksum of the file content.

sha256Checksum.description: SHA256 checksum of the file content.

mimeType.description: MIME type of the file content.

filePath.description: Path to file for content upload (creates new revision).

content_updates.description: Dictionary containing media content properties to update with keys:

parent_folders_to_add.description: Comma-separated list of parent IDs to add, defaults to ''.

mandate_single_parent.description: Whether to enforce single parent, defaults to False.

parent_folders_to_remove.description: Comma-separated list of parent IDs to remove, defaults to ''.

name: modify_file_access_permission
description: Updates a permission with patch semantics.

file_id_for_permission_update.description: The ID of the file or shared drive.

permission_id_to_modify.description: The ID of the permission to update.

role.description:
The role granted by this permission. Possible values:
    - 'viewer': Can view the file, (alias for 'reader')
    - 'commenter': Can view and comment on the file
    - 'editor': Can view, comment, and edit the file (alias for 'writer')
    - 'owner': Has full control over the file

type.description:
The type of the grantee. Possible values:
    - 'user': Permission granted to a specific user
    - 'group': Permission granted to a group
    - 'domain': Permission granted to a domain
    - 'anyone': Permission granted to anyone with the link

emailAddress.description: The email address of the user or group.

domain.description: The domain name of the entity this permission refers to.

allowFileDiscovery.description: Whether the permission allows the file to be discovered through search.

expirationTime.description: The time at which this permission will expire.

permission_update_payload.description: Dictionary of permission properties to update with keys:

assign_new_owner.description: Whether to transfer ownership to the specified user and downgrade the current owner to a writer.

name: modify_shared_drive_properties
description:
Updates the metadata for a shared drive.

This function modifies an existing shared drive's metadata based on the
provided `body`. The drive is identified by its `driveId`.

target_drive_for_update_id.description: The ID of the shared drive.

name.description: The name of the shared drive.

adminManagedRestrictions.description: Whether administrative privileges on this shared drive are required to modify restrictions.

copyRequiresWriterPermission.description: Whether the options to copy, print, or download files inside this shared drive, should be disabled for readers and commenters.

domainUsersOnly.description: Whether access to this shared drive and items inside this shared drive is restricted to users of the domain to which this shared drive belongs.

driveMembersOnly.description: Whether access to items inside this shared drive is restricted to its members.

hidden.description: Whether the shared drive is hidden from default view.

themeId.description: The ID of the theme to apply to this shared drive.

drive_metadata_payload.description: Dictionary of drive properties to update with keys:

name: monitor_drive_modifications
description:
Creates a simulated notification channel for watching changes in Google Drive.

This function simulates setting up a watch channel for changes to files in 
a user's Drive or shared drive. In the simulation, it stores the channel 
configuration and validates the watch parameters, but does not establish 
actual real-time notifications.

starting_page_token_for_watch.description:
The token for the initial page of changes to watch from.
This token is obtained from changes.getStartPageToken() or a previous 
changes.list request. Cannot be empty.

id.description: Required. Unique identifier for the channel.

address.description: Required. URL where notifications are delivered.

resourceId.description: Optional. ID of the resource being watched.

resourceUri.description: Optional. URI of the resource being watched.

token.description: Optional. Token for authenticating the channel.

expiration.description: Optional. Expiration time in RFC 3339 format.

payload.description: Optional. Whether to include payload in notifications.

watch_channel_configuration.description:
Dictionary of notification channel 
properties. If None, a minimal channel will be created. Expected keys:

drive_id_to_watch.description:
The ID of the shared drive for which changes are watched.
Only changes to files within this shared drive will trigger notifications.
Defaults to empty string (user's My Drive).

notify_on_corpus_removals.description:
Whether the watch should include notifications 
for files that are removed from the corpus but still accessible.
Defaults to False.

watch_all_drives.description:
Whether to watch changes in both My Drive 
and shared drives. Defaults to False.

notify_on_item_removal.description:
Whether to include notifications for removed items.
Defaults to True.

watch_team_drive_items.description:
**DEPRECATED** - Use includeItemsFromAllDrives 
instead. Whether to include changes for team drive items. Defaults to False.

notification_batch_size.description:
Maximum number of changes to return per notification. 
Must be between 1 and 1000 inclusive. Defaults to 100.

limit_watch_to_my_drive.description:
Whether to restrict notifications to changes 
inside the My Drive hierarchy only. Cannot be used with driveId or teamDriveId.
Defaults to False.

spaces_to_monitor.description:
A comma-separated list of spaces to watch for changes.
Supported values are 'drive', 'appDataFolder', and 'photos'. Defaults to 'drive'.

enable_all_drives_monitoring.description:
Whether the requesting application supports both 
My Drives and shared drives. Required when driveId is specified. Defaults to False.

enable_team_drives_monitoring.description:
**DEPRECATED** - Use supportsAllDrives instead.
Whether the application supports Team Drives. Defaults to False.

team_drive_id_to_watch.description:
**DEPRECATED** - Use driveId instead. The ID of the Team Drive 
to watch for changes. Defaults to empty string.

include_view_permissions_in_notification.description:
Specifies which additional view's permissions 
to include in change notifications. Only 'published' is supported. 
Defaults to empty string.

include_labels_in_notifications.description:
A comma-separated list of label IDs to include in 
the labelInfo part of change notifications. Defaults to empty string.

name: overwrite_file_data
description:
Update file content with new bytes data.

This function updates the content of a file with new bytes data. It calculates
a new checksum for the new content, encodes it to base64, and creates a new
content structure matching the expected JSON format. The function then validates
the new content using the FileContentModel and creates a new revision before
updating the file's content and size. Finally, it clears the export cache since
the content has changed.

updating_user_id.description: The ID of the user updating the file content.

file_id_to_overwrite.description: The ID of the file to which content is being updated.

replacement_byte_data.description: The new content to be added to the file.

name: provision_new_shared_drive
description:
Creates a shared drive. If requestId is provided, it's used as the drive's ID and for idempotency.

Otherwise, an internal ID is generated.

idempotency_request_token.description:
An ID, such as a random UUID. If provided, this ID is used
as the drive's ID. If a drive with this ID already exists,
it is returned. If None or empty, an internal ID is
generated for a new drive.

name.description: The name of the shared drive.

adminManagedRestrictions.description: Whether administrative privileges on this shared drive are required to modify restrictions.

copyRequiresWriterPermission.description: Whether the options to copy, print, or download files inside this shared drive, should be disabled for readers and commenters.

domainUsersOnly.description: Whether access to this shared drive and items inside this shared drive is restricted to users of the domain to which this shared drive belongs.

driveMembersOnly.description: Whether access to items inside this shared drive is restricted to its members.

restrictions.description: A dictionary of restrictions to apply to the drive, with keys:

hidden.description: Whether the shared drive is hidden from default view.

themeId.description: The ID of the theme to apply to this shared drive.

drive_configuration_details.description: Dictionary of drive properties. Valid keys:

name: purge_trash_bin
description: Permanently deletes all of the trashed files owned by the user.

shared_drive_identifier_to_empty.description: The ID of the shared drive to empty trash from.

name: query_user_drive_items
description: Lists the user's files with support for Shared Drives, ordering, and pagination.

search_corpora_selection.description:
Comma-separated list of corpora. Defaults to 'user', which means
only files owned by or shared with the user will be returned.

target_drive_id_for_query.description:
ID of the shared drive to search. Defaults to empty string,
meaning no specific drive filtering is applied.

scan_all_user_drives.description:
Whether to include items from all drives.
Defaults to False, meaning only items from the user's My Drive are included.

scan_team_drive_content.description:
Whether to include team drive items.
Defaults to False, meaning team drive items are excluded.

sort_results_by_clause.description:
Sort order for the results. Defaults to 'folder,modifiedTime desc,name',
which means:
- Folders are listed first
- Then files are sorted by modified time in descending order (newest first)
- Finally, items with the same modified time are sorted by name

results_per_page.description:
Maximum number of files to return. Must be a positive integer.
Defaults to 10, meaning at most 10 files will be returned per page.

next_page_cursor.description:
Token for the next page of results. Defaults to empty string,
meaning the first page of results will be returned.

search_filter_query.description:
Query string for filtering files. Defaults to empty string,
meaning no filtering is applied. The query string should follow the format: `field operator value`.
Logical Operators:
Multiple conditions can be combined using `and` and `or` logical operators.
For example, `name = 'file.txt' and trashed = False or mimeType = 'image/jpeg'`
is processed as `(name = 'file.txt' and trashed = False) or (mimeType = 'image/jpeg')`.
Parentheses for explicitly grouping conditions (e.g., `A and (B or C)`) are not supported.
not supported by the current parser. To achieve a query like `A and (B or C)`,
you must write it in disjunctive normal form: `(A and B) or (A and C)`.
For instance:
`(name contains 'report' and mimeType = 'application/pdf') or (name contains 'report' and mimeType = 'text/plain')`
Supported Operators:
   - `=`: Equals. For exact matches.
   - `!=`: Not equals.
   - `contains`: Checks if the field's string representation contains the given value.
   (e.g., `name contains 'report'`).
   - `<`: Less than. Used for numeric or date/time fields.
   - `<=`: Less than or equal to. Used for numeric or date/time fields.
   - `>`: Greater than. Used for numeric or date/time fields.
   - `>=`: Greater than or equal to. Used for numeric or date/time fields.
   - `in`: Checks if a specific string value is present within a list-like field (e.g., `parents`).
   The syntax is `'stringValue' in fieldName`.
   For example, `'folderId123' in parents` checks if `'folderId123'`
   is one of the IDs in the `parents` list of a file.
Value Types:
   - Strings: Must be enclosed in single (`'`) or double (`"`) quotes
   (e.g., `name = 'My Document.pdf'` or `description = "Final Report"`).
   - Booleans: Use `True` or `False` (case-insensitive)
   (e.g., `trashed = False` or `starred = True`).
   - Date/Timestamps: For fields like `modifiedTime` or `createdTime`.
   Values should be in a standard date/time format that can be parsed
   (e.g., ISO 8601 format like `'2023-10-26T10:00:00Z'`).
Filterable Fields:
You can attempt to filter on any field present in the file resource dictionary.
Common fields include:
   - `name` (str): The name of the file.
   - `mimeType` (str): The MIME type of the file
   - `trashed` (bool): Whether the file is in the trash.
   - `starred` (bool): Whether the file is starred.
   - `createdTime` (str): The creation time (e.g., `'2024-01-01T00:00:00Z'`).
   - `modifiedTime` (str): The last modification time.
   - `parents` (List[str]): A list of parent folder IDs. Use with the `in` operator.
   - `id` (str): The unique ID of the file.
   - `description` (str): The file's description.
Examples of `q` strings:
   - `name = 'MyContract.pdf' and trashed = false`
   - `mimeType = 'application/vnd.google-apps.folder' or starred = true`
   - `modifiedTime > '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z'`
   - `'specific_folder_id' in parents and name contains 'confidential'`
   - `(description contains 'secret' and mimeType = 'application/pdf') or (description contains 'secret' and mimeType = 'text/csv')`

data_spaces_to_search.description:
Comma-separated list of spaces to search. Defaults to 'drive',
which means only files in the user's Drive will be returned.

enable_cross_drive_search.description:
Whether to support all drives. Defaults to False,
meaning shared drive operations are not supported.

enable_team_drive_search.description:
Whether to support team drives. Defaults to False,
meaning team drive operations are not supported.

target_team_drive_id_for_query.description:
ID of the team drive to search. Defaults to empty string,
meaning no specific team drive filtering is applied.

request_extra_view_permissions.description:
Specifies which additional view's permissions to include.
Defaults to empty string, meaning no additional permissions are included.

request_included_labels.description:
Comma-separated list of labels to include. Defaults to empty string,
meaning no label filtering is applied.

name: remove_comment_from_file
description:
Deletes a comment from a file in Google Drive.

This function permanently removes a comment from a file. The comment is
identified by its `commentId` and the `fileId` of the file it is associated
with. If the comment does not exist or the provided IDs are incorrect,
an error will be raised.

file_id_containing_comment.description: The ID of the file the comment belongs to.

comment_id_to_delete.description: The ID of the comment to delete.

name: remove_reply_from_comment
description: Deletes a reply.

reply_id_to_delete.description: The ID of the reply to delete.

name: remove_shared_drive_permanently
description:
Permanently deletes a shared drive for which the user is an organizer.

This function permanently removes a shared drive from the user's account. The drive
must be identified by its unique `driveId`. For the operation to succeed, the user
must have the appropriate permissions (e.g., be an organizer) for the specified drive.
Once deleted, the drive and all of its contents are irretrievably lost.

shared_drive_to_delete_id.description: The unique identifier of the shared drive to be deleted.

name: request_initial_change_cursor
description:
Gets the starting pageToken for listing future changes.

This method retrieves a starting page token that can be used to list changes
to files in a user's Drive or a shared drive. The page token doesn't expire
and should be stored for subsequent change tracking operations.

target_drive_id_for_token.description:
The ID of the shared drive for which the starting 
pageToken for listing future changes will be returned. Must be a valid 
shared drive ID if provided. Defaults to empty string (user's My Drive).

enable_all_drives_for_token.description:
Whether the requesting application 
supports both My Drives and shared drives. When True, enables access 
to shared drive content. Defaults to False.

enable_team_drives_for_token.description:
**DEPRECATED** - Use supportsAllDrives 
instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version. Defaults to False.

target_team_drive_id_for_token.description:
**DEPRECATED** - Use driveId instead. 
This parameter will be removed in a future version. Defaults to empty string.

name: retrieve_application_information
description: Gets a specific app.

application_identifier.description: The ID of the app to retrieve.

name: retrieve_drive_user_profile
description:
Gets information about the user's Drive account.

This function retrieves account information for the authenticated user
from the Google Drive API. The response can be filtered to include
only specific fields using the fields parameter.

requested_profile_fields.description:
A comma-separated list of fields to include in the response.
Use '*' to include all fields (default).
For partial responses, use comma-separated field names (e.g., 'user,storageQuota').
For nested fields, use dot notation (e.g., 'user.displayName,storageQuota.limit').
Field names are case-sensitive and whitespace around commas is ignored.

name: retrieve_shared_drive_info
description: Gets a shared drive's metadata by ID.

drive_id_to_query.description: The ID of the shared drive.

name: reveal_shared_drive_in_view
description: Restores a shared drive to the default view.

drive_id_to_unhide.description: The ID of the shared drive.

name: revoke_file_access
description: Deletes a permission.

target_file_id_for_revocation.description: The ID of the file or shared drive.

permission_id_to_revoke.description: The ID of the permission to delete.

enable_all_drives_access_for_revocation.description: Whether to support all drives. Defaults to False.

enable_team_drives_access_for_revocation.description: Whether to support team drives. Defaults to False.

as_domain_administrator.description: Whether to use domain admin access. Defaults to False.

name: terminate_notification_channel
description: Stops watching resources through this channel.

id.description: The ID of the channel to stop.

resourceId.description: The ID of the resource being watched.

resourceUri.description: The URI of the resource being watched.

token.description: The token used to authenticate the channel.

expiration.description: The time at which the channel will expire (RFC3339 format).

address.description: The address where notifications are delivered.

payload.description: Whether to include the payload in notifications.

channel_resource_to_stop.description:
Dictionary of channel properties. 
If None or empty dictionary, no action is taken. Required key:

name: watch_file_for_updates
description: Subscribes to changes to a file.

file_to_monitor_id.description: The ID of the file to watch.

notification_channel_config.description: Dictionary of watch properties with keys:

get_permissions_for_view.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include.

get_labels_in_notification.description: Comma-separated list of labels to include.
